item.title: 美国 6 月成屋销售下滑，中位价创历史新高
item.description: 由于房价中位数再创新高，6 月份美国成屋销售降幅超过预期，但供应量的增加和抵押贷款利率的下降为未来几个月房屋销售活动的反弹带来了希望。【原文：U.S. existing home sales fell more than expected in June as the median house price set another record high, but improving supply and declining mortgage rates offered hope that activity could rebound in the months ahead.】

item.title: 国内市场停滞不前，美国和加拿大大麻企业将增长目光投向德国
item.description: 在德国大麻使用部分合法化之后，北美大麻公司面对禁止性法律、过度拥挤的市场和国内根深蒂固的非法行业，正在加大对德国的投资。【原文：North American cannabis firms, facing prohibitive laws, an overcrowded market and a deeply entrenched illicit sector at home are ramping up investments in Germany after the country partly legalized marijuana use.】

item.title: 美国联邦贸易委员会调查基于个人数据的定向定价
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会已经启动了一项产品研究，该产品可允许公司根据消费者的位置、过去的购物记录和其他个人数据为其设定不同的价格。【原文：The U.S. Federal Trade Commission has launched a study of products that could allow companies to set different prices for consumers based on their locations, past purchases, and other personal data.】

item.title: 巴克莱将 2024 年标准普尔 500 指数目标从 5,300 点上调至 5,600 点
item.description: 巴克莱银行周二将基准 S&P 500 指数 2024 年的目标值从 5300 点上调至 5600 点，因为它预计巨型科技公司的利润将强劲增长。【原文：Barclays on Tuesday lifted its 2024 target for the benchmark S&P 500 index to 5,600 from 5,300 as it expects strong profit growth for mega-cap technology firms.】

item.title: 经济学家称，美联储今年将降息两次，第一次在 9 月：路透调查
item.description: 在路透社的一项民意调查中，越来越多的经济学家表示，美联储今年将仅在9月和12月降息两次，因为尽管通胀有所缓解，但美国消费者需求的恢复仍需要采取谨慎的态度。【原文：The Federal Reserve will cut interest rates just twice this year, in September and December, as resilient U.S. consumer demand warrants a cautious approach despite easing inflation, according to a growing majority of economists in a Reuters poll.】

item.title: 全食超市就前员工有关黑人生命事件面具的诉讼达成和解
item.description: 全食超市（Whole Foods）已就一起诉讼达成和解协议，该诉讼指控全食超市非法解雇了一名拒绝摘下 "黑人生命至上 "面罩并抱怨亚马逊公司旗下高档杂货连锁店种族歧视的员工。【原文：Whole Foods has reached an agreement to settle a lawsuit accusing it of illegally firing a worker who refused to remove her Black Lives Matter facemask and complained about racism at the Amazon.com-owned upscale grocery chain.】

item.title: 分析需求强劲，穆迪上调 2024 年盈利预测，高于预期
item.description: 评级机构穆迪公司（Moody's Corp）上调了全年调整后利润预期，高于华尔街预期，原因是其研究和分析产品需求强劲。【原文：Ratings agency Moody's Corp raised its forecast for full-year adjusted profit above Wall Street estimates, driven by strong demand for its research and analytics products.】

item.title: 独家报道在对迪奥承包商进行调查后，一些投资者要求路威酩轩集团做出改变
item.description: 三位投资者告诉路透社，在意大利检察官披露高端品牌迪奥的分包商涉嫌存在类似血汗工厂的条件后，欧洲顶级资产管理公司 Amundi 和其他 LVMH 投资者希望这家由亿万富翁 Bernard Arnault 控制的价值 3700 亿美元的奢侈品巨头采取更积极的措施，监督其供应商对待工人的情况。【原文：Europe's top asset manager Amundi and other LVMH investors want the $370 billion luxury behemoth controlled by billionaire Bernard Arnault to take more aggressive steps to monitor its suppliers' treatment of workers after Italian prosecutors disclosed alleged sweatshop-like conditions at subcontractors for high-end brand Dior, three investors told Reuters.】

item.title: 航班大面积取消后，美国对达美航空展开调查
item.description: 美国运输部周二表示，正在对达美航空展开调查，因为该航空公司自上周五以来取消了 5,000 多个航班，努力从导致全球航班瘫痪的全球网络故障中恢复过来。【原文：The U.S. Transportation Department said on Tuesday that it is opening an investigation into Delta Air Lines after the carrier canceled more than 5,000 flights since Friday as it struggles to recover from a global cyber outage that snarled flights worldwide.】

item.title: 菲利普-莫里斯公司因尼古丁袋需求而上调年度利润预期
item.description: 菲利普莫里斯国际公司（Philip Morris International）周二上调了年度调整后利润预期，原因是对其 Zyn 尼古丁袋的需求稳定，而且香烟价格上涨。【原文：Philip Morris International raised its annual adjusted profit forecast on Tuesday, owing to steady demand for its Zyn nicotine pouches and higher prices of its cigarettes.】

item.title: 指数产品需求强劲，MSCI 盈利增加
item.description: MSCI 周二公布的第二季度调整后利润增长了近 12%，原因是客户支出的增加推动了对该公司指数产品和分析服务的需求。【原文：MSCI reported a second-quarter adjusted profit on Tuesday that rose nearly 12% as improved spending by clients drove up demand for the company's index products and analytics services.】

item.title: PulteGroup 因住宅销售增长，季度利润超出预期
item.description: 美国住宅建筑商普尔特集团（PulteGroup）周二公布的第二季度利润超出华尔街预期，原因是现房严重短缺推动了对新建筑的需求。【原文：U.S. homebuilder PulteGroup beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Tuesday, as an acute shortage of existing houses drove up demand for new constructions.】

item.title: 谢尔温-威廉姆斯（Sherwin-Williams）上调 2024 年利润预期，原因是住宅需求即将到来
item.description: 谢尔温-威廉姆斯公司（Sherwin-Williams）周二上调了全年盈利预期，公布的第二季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，原因是油漆价格上涨，油漆店和涂料部门的销售额增加。【原文：Sherwin-Williams on Tuesday raised its full-year earnings forecast and posted a second-quarter profit that beat Wall Street estimates, as the paintmaker was helped by higher prices and increased sales across its paint stores and coating segments.】

item.title: 卡塔尔航空公司权衡宽体客机选择，空中客车公司抢购交易
item.description: 空中客车公司周二在范堡罗航展上宣布了与日本航空公司和维珍航空公司的飞机交易，而卡塔尔航空公司则表示有望在今年年底或 2025 年初获得 "相当规模 "的宽体喷气机订单。【原文：Airbus announced plane deals with Japan Airlines and Virgin Atlantic at the Farnborough Airshow on Tuesday, while Qatar Airways held out the prospect of a "sizeable" order for wide-body jets around the end of this year or in early 2025.】

item.title: 医疗保健需求强劲，HCA 医疗保健公司上调年度盈利预期
item.description: HCA Healthcare 周二上调了全年盈利预期，此前该公司的季度盈利超过了华尔街的预期，使得这家医院运营商的股价在盘前上涨了近 7%。【原文：HCA Healthcare raised its annual profit forecast on Tuesday, after beating Wall Street estimates for quarterly earnings, sending shares of the hospital operator up nearly 7% before the bell.】

item.title: 意大利没收亚马逊公司 1.21 亿欧元，涉嫌税务和劳工犯罪
item.description: 检察官周二的文件显示，意大利税务警察从电子商务巨头亚马逊的一家意大利分公司扣押了约 1.21 亿欧元，作为涉嫌税务欺诈和非法劳工行为调查的一部分。【原文：Italy's tax police have seized some 121 million euros from an Italian unit of e-commerce giant Amazon as part of an investigation into alleged tax fraud and illegal labour practices, prosecutors' documents showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司因战斗机和导弹需求提高 2024 年销售目标
item.description: 在五角大楼上周开始接收F-35战机后，洛克希德-马丁公司出人意料地恢复了F-35战机的交付。【原文：U.S. defense company Lockheed Martin raised its annual sales target for the first time this year on Tuesday, following the unexpected resumption of deliveries of its F-35 aircraft after Pentagon began accepting the jets last week.】

item.title: 消息人士称，中国电动卡车初创企业 Windrose 将在美国上市前融资 2 亿美元
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士说，中国电动卡车初创企业风卓公司（Windrose）的目标是在寻求在美国首次公开募股之前，在最后一轮融资中通过股权投资和债务融资筹集 2 亿美元。【原文：Chinese electric truck startup Windrose is aiming to raise $200 million in its final round of funding in equity investments and debt before it seeks an initial public offering in the United States, a person with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 工会称三星电子与工会的谈判无果而终
item.description: 三星电子和韩国最大的工会代表周二举行了会谈，但会谈无果而终。【原文：Samsung Electronics and representatives of its biggest workers' union in South Korea, which has been on a strike, met on Tuesday but the talks ended without results, the union said.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉通胀降温--但选民表示仍入不敷出
item.description: 委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯-马杜罗将于周日寻求连任，他的政府在遏制之前的高通胀方面取得了一些成功，但工人们说，他们的工资还赶不上食品和其他商品的高价格。【原文：The government of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro, who is seeking reelection on Sunday, has had some success in curbing formerly sky-high inflation, but workers say their salaries have not caught up with high prices for food and other goods.】

item.title: 由于制片厂和主题公园业务疲软，康卡斯特季度收入不及预期
item.description: 本周二，康卡斯特公司的季度营收未达预期，原因是这家美国电信和媒体公司在此期间上映的电影数量减少，而其主题公园的入园率也持续走低。【原文：Comcast missed estimates for quarterly revenue on Tuesday as the U.S. telecom and media firm had fewer movie releases during the period, while attendance at its theme parks stayed low.】

item.title: 需求稳定，可口可乐上调年度销售额和利润预期
item.description: 可口可乐公司周二上调了年度有机销售额和利润预期，表明这家饮料巨头在美国和国际市场对其汽水、能量饮料和果汁的需求强劲。【原文：Coca-Cola raised its annual organic sales and profit forecast on Tuesday, signaling strong demand for the beverage giant's sodas, energy drinks and juices in its U.S. and international markets.】

item.title: 日本航空公司订购 20 架空客 A350 型飞机和 11 架 A321neos 型飞机
item.description: 空中客车公司飞机制造主管克里斯蒂安-舍勒（Christian Scherer）周二在范堡罗航展上表示，日本航空公司已经订购了20架空客A350-900和11架A321neo飞机。【原文：Japan Airlines has ordered 20 Airbus A350-900 and 11 A321neo planes, Airbus's planemaking chief Christian Scherer said at the Farnborough Airshow on Tuesday.】

item.title: 金佰利上调年度利润预期，第二季度每股收益因价格上涨而超出预期
item.description: Kleenex 纸巾制造商金佰利-克拉克公司周二上调了全年利润预期，此前该公司第二季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，押注于其个人护理产品价格上涨和需求稳定。【原文：Kleenex tissue maker Kimberly-Clark on Tuesday raised its forecast for full-year profit after beating Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit, betting on higher prices and steady demand for its personal care products.】

item.title: 通用汽车搁置不带方向盘的自动驾驶汽车
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）的 Cruise 自动驾驶部门表示，将把开发重点放在下一代雪佛兰 Bolt 上，而不是其计划中的没有方向盘或其他人工控制装置的未来主义 Origin 汽车上。【原文：General Motors' Cruise self-driving unit will focus its development efforts on a next-generation Chevrolet Bolt rather than its planned futuristic Origin vehicle that would not have a steering wheel or other human controls, the automaker said.】

item.title: 通用汽车第二季度业绩超出预期，再次上调业绩预期
item.description: 通用汽车公司周二公布的第二季度利润和收入均超出华尔街预期，并在今年第二次上调了全年利润预期，这主要得益于强劲的价格和对汽油动力卡车的需求。【原文：General Motors reported second-quarter profit and revenue on Tuesday that beat Wall Street's expectations, and raised its annual profit forecast for a second time this year, buoyed by strong pricing and demand for gas-powered trucks.】

item.title: 发动机零部件和服务需求强劲，通用电气航空航天集团上调 2024 年盈利预期
item.description: 通用电气航空航天公司周二上调了年度盈利预期，原因是新飞机短缺促使航空公司继续保留旧飞机，从而对包括喷气发动机零部件在内的售后服务需求强劲。【原文：GE Aerospace raised its annual profit forecast on Tuesday on strong demand for its aftermarket services, including jet-engine parts, as a shortage of new planes prompted airlines to keep older ones in the air.】

item.title: 印度联合利华第一季度利润增长
item.description: 印度的印度斯坦联合利华公司周二公布第一季度利润增长，原因是期待已久的农村经济复苏引发了核心部门的需求复苏。【原文：India's Hindustan Unilever posted a higher first-quarter profit on Tuesday, as much awaited rural recovery sparked demand revival in core segments.】

item.title: 早间新闻大盘报告，哈里斯入选，中国摇摆不定
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 焦点转向科技财报，期货下跌
item.description: 周二，美国股指期货下滑，因为一些大型科技公司将在当天晚些时候发布财报，这些公司的财报将被用来分析市场近期破纪录的走势是否可持续。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Tuesday ahead of results from some Big Tech companies expected later in the day that will be parsed to see whether the market's recent record-breaking run is sustainable.】
